comments.body:
Even if it's super simple, can you add some docs to the helper methods that implement the pythonisations? Example:
https://github.com/root-project/root/blob/master/bindings/pyroot_experimental/PyROOT/python/ROOT/pythonization/_th1.py#L17

def _rsub(self, other):

comments.body:
Please check the code I shared with you yesterday:
https://github.com/xbmc/python/blob/master/Demo/classes/Complex.py
and see how the div operator is implemented. You actually don't need to do all these operations, you just need to create a `TComplex` for `other` and return `other / self`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +18,22 @@    return -self+other

def _perform_division(self, other):
    # Parameters:
    # - self: complex number
